Description: Postcard; printed paper; monochrome (sepia) photograph showing a kettle drummer for joyful corteges in Egypt.
Curator's comments: Old card; postally unused but message on the reverse dated 31/3/16 and reads: "Sidi Bishri. My dearest Florrie, I am just sending ... a few pcs [postcards] that you know that I am still alive & kicking. Your letter which I should have received before the last hasn't yet arrived although another mail has arrived (mid week). Do you ever ask at the P.O. [Post Office] to find out if you can send an extra letter a week? Holland gets one when there is an extra mail but I don't. What". The message must have continued on another card. The content is typical of First World War cards and confirmed by the date of the message. The same sender and recipient as EPH-ME 2929-2930.
